description: This file defines the interface 'ICompositionBuffer' within the WPEFramework's Exchange namespace. It provides an abstract representation for a composition buffer used in rendering pipelines, including nested interfaces for plane access and iteration, as well as methods for reference counting, buffer properties, and rendering control.

classes.name: ICompositionBuffer
classes.description: An interface for a hardware-optimized frame buffer, supporting multiple planes, methods for reference counting, identifying the buffer, accessing properties such as width, height, format, and performing rendering operations.

classes.name: ICompositionBuffer::IPlane
classes.description: Represents a single image plane within the composition buffer, providing access to data pointers, stride, and offset.

classes.name: ICompositionBuffer::IIterator
classes.description: Iterator interface for traversing the planes within a composition buffer.

methods.name: AddRef
methods.description: Increments the reference count of the buffer object.

methods.name: Release
methods.description: Decrements the reference count of the buffer object.

methods.name: Identifier
methods.description: Returns a unique identifier for the buffer.

methods.name: Planes
methods.description: Provides an iterator to access the planes in the buffer, with a specified timeout.

methods.name: Completed
methods.description: Indicates that the caller has finished working with the planes, possibly with a 'dirty' state indicator.

methods.name: Render
methods.description: Marks the buffer for scanout or display.

methods.name: Width
methods.description: Returns the width of the buffer in pixels.

methods.name: Height
methods.description: Returns the height of the buffer in pixels.

methods.name: Format
methods.description: Returns the pixel format of the buffer.

methods.name: Modifier
methods.description: Returns the pixel arrangement modifier, used for hardware-optimized layouts.

methods.name: Type
methods.description: Returns the type of data contained in the buffer, such as DMA or raw.
